block.p: Laura Anne Dickinson, an adviser at the State Department, and Paul Schiff Berman, a law professor, are to be married today at Oxon Hill Manor in Oxon Hill, Md. Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg of the United States Supreme Court, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, is to perform the ceremony.
The couple met at the Supreme Court, where the bride was a law clerk to Justice Harry A. Blackmun and to Justice Stephen G. Breyer.

Laura Anne Dickinson, an adviser at the State Department, and Paul Schiff Berman, a law professor, are to be married today at Oxon Hill Manor in Oxon Hill, Md. Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg of the United States Supreme Court, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, is to perform the ceremony.
The couple met at the Supreme Court, where the bride was a law clerk to Justice Harry A. Blackmun and to Justice Stephen G. Breyer.

Ms. Dickinson, 29, will keep her name. She is a policy adviser and special assistant to Harold Koh, the State Department's chief human rights officer, in Washington. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received a law degree from Yale University.

The bride is the daughter of Joan Dickinson Gordon of New Haven and Martin H. Dickinson of Washington, and the stepdaughter of Phyllis Torda and of Robert W. Gordon. The bride's father is the vice president for development at Communities and Schools, an Alexandria, Va., organization, which works to keep students from dropping out of school. Her mother, a former lawyer, is a doctoral candidate in linguistics at Yale.

Mr. Berman, 34, is an associate professor at the University of Connecticut School of Law in Hartford. He graduated summa cum laude from Princeton University and the New York University School of Law. He is a son of Ellyn and Benjamin Berman of New York. His mother administers a work-study program for social workers who are pursuing advanced degrees at the Hunter College School of Social Work in New York. His father, who is retired, was the president of Chesterfield Jewelers, a former manufacturer in New York.
